info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central McCulloch and central San Saba Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strengthening thunderstorms from the McCullough and San Saba County line northeast across the town of San Saba to the Colorado River. The storms were moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. The strongest of these thunderstorms will be near... Sloan around 215 PM CDT. Algerita around 220 PM CDT. San Saba around 230 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Harkeyville, Spring Creek and Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Texas.
